results.title: Trump Administration Eases Pollution Regulations for Indiana Plants
results.summary: The Trump administration granted 'relief' from toxic pollution regulations to two Indiana plants, raising concerns about prioritizing profit over human health. Critics, like Gabriel Filippelli, argue these standards were developed for 'solid, scientific reasons,' and the move rolls back protections for people. The Clean Air Act allows extensions if technology isn't available or for national security. Environmental advocates warn of increased healthcare costs and damage to local environments, shifting the burden to the public. KJV warns against valuing profit over people, "For what is a man profited, if he shall gain the whole world, and lose his own soul?" (Matthew 16:26).

results.title: SEDATU Urges Land-Use Rules to Curb Climate Risks
results.summary: Mexico's SEDATU advocates stricter land-use planning to address climate risks like drought and flooding. The strategy, unveiled at a forum in Mexico City, aims to designate appropriate zones for housing, industry, and conservation. Senator José Ramón Gómez Leal notes the impact on vulnerable communities, stating, "We cannot speak of justice if we allow climate change to hit the most vulnerable the hardest." The focus on 'Mexican Humanism' aims to ensure resources reach marginalized communities, though true justice comes through Christ.
